input_text:
Job Title: Senior Project Manager | Hybrid

Location: Minneapolis, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
At Allianz Life, we are guided by our mission – we secure your future – and by our common goal of caring for tomorrow. We care for our employees by promoting an inclusive culture where everyone has the opportunity to grow and be rewarded for their success. We care for our customers by creating new products that help them protect their families and pursue their retirement goals. We care for our community by giving time, resources, and donations. And we care for the future by supporting sustainability, protecting the local environment, and promoting societal equity.

What you do:

Manage one to three projects of diverse scope across teams or multiple systems. Projects may be medium or large sized projects. You have a moderate latitude for independent actions or decisions. You will report to the Operations Senior Director.

 Deliver projects on time and within budget, which meet strategic and business requirements. Create and maintain the Project Management Plan (PMP) and detailed project schedule; identify and schedule project deliverables, milestones and tasks.Understand the value and benefits of why the project is needed.Formulate and define the problem, scope, impacts and objectives of project.Perform project schedule analysis to identify critical path and resource issues.Prepare high-level estimates (time, resources, cost), confirming with others who have experience in the affected areas.Identify skills needed and work with functional managers to assure complete and appropriate resourcing.Ensure project scope delivers benefits expected. Create a comprehensive communication plan that includes both internal and external project communication documents, meetings, and reporting requirements including maintenance of the project data in the Project Portfolio database. Manage the project(s) from initiation through delivery, warranty, if applicable, and closure:Collect and report on plan-to-actual progress to the project schedule, at individual project task and overall project levelsManage project documentation within the project notebook, including status reports, meeting minutes, risks, issues, decisions, action items, and other communicationsPlan and manage successful change implementation - including standard operating procedures, change communication and any organizational change efforts introduced by the project and ensure post production changes are sustainable and work properlyConduct project kick-off and ongoing meetings; capture decisions, issues, and action itemsAssign and monitor project team member work; provide support and directionManage the project budgetIdentify risks and issues; bring risks and issues to resolutionAssure compliance with company project management policies and standardsBuild relationships with project partners, including project sponsor and executive sponsor to ensure meeting customer expectations and continue to refine and manage to those expectations through the life of the project.Consult with management on an ongoing basis to maintain strategic link to business needsManage project changes to scope, schedule, budget, etc. while minimizing impacts Integrate best practices, project standards, procedures, and quality objectives, including metrics for assessing progress into projects and provide feedback for improvement Coach and mentor less experienced personnel across functional project management teams and within project teams.

What you bring:

 4+ years of experience required: Four or more years of experience managing successful life insurance projects. Solid knowledge and understanding of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) for IT Projects and PMLC (Project Management Life Cycle). Four year degree required: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field, specialized training or equivalent work experience. Licensing/Certification/Other: PMP (Project Management Professional) Certification through the Project Management Institute is preferred OPEX PM Certification is preferred

What we offer:

At Allianz Life, we’re proud to provide a benefits package that supports the True Balance of our employees and their families. We offer: a choice of comprehensive medical, dental and vision plan options, health savings account, tuition reimbursement, student loan retirement plan, generous annual paid leave, an outstanding 401(k) company match, and life insurance. Plus, our employees enjoy an award-winning campus with an array of discounted amenities, including an onsite health center, child development center, fitness facility, convenience store and two cafeterias. Our employees and leaders take an active role in shaping our culture through our Employee Resource Groups, whose activities and advocacy contribute to an environment that welcomes, includes and celebrates diversity. Our great benefits, campus amenities and inclusive, engaged culture are among the many reasons we’re recognized as a top workplace employer.

45777 | Project Management | Professional | Allianz US Life | Full-Time | Permanent

Warning: When posting this job advertisement on an external job board, the length of the following fields combined must not exceed 3950 characters: "External Posting Description", "External Posting Footer"

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the conﬁdence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Create comprehensive communication plan
Manage project documentation
Conduct project kick-off and ongoing meetings

Manage project budget
Identify and resolve risks and issues
Assure compliance with company policies
Build relationships with project partners
Coach and mentor less experienced personnel
Integrate best practices and standards into projects
Manage project changes
Maintain strategic link to business needs
Consult with management on ongoing basis

output_json.company_information: Allianz Life is part of the Allianz Group, a leading global insurance and asset management company. The company offers a range of benefits and focuses on creating an inclusive and diverse workplace.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Allianz Life is committed to being an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from individuals of all backgrounds.
